publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: The triumphs of the Prince d'Amour : A masque presented by His Highnesse at his pallace in the Middle Temple, the 24th of Februarie 1635
monogr.author: D'Avenant, William, Sir

div.head: TO EVERY READER.
div.p:
THe intention of this Entertainement to the Prince ELECTOR, being hastily prepar'd, as from eager hearts that could delay no Ceremony that might render an expression of their Loves: Jt could not be, but I must share the inconvenience of that hast: since length and aptitude of time is still allow'd to these Composures: And this (devis'd and written in three dayes) might happely have found an excuse, if the presentation had beene as suddenly perform'd, as it was prepar'd: but
there was a sad necessitie for the delay; and J may justly stile it a misfortune, that the generall worke could not receive the benefit of alteration by that unprofitable leasure, which since we have rather lost than enjoy'd. Though some Truthes are not conveniently urg'd, this J was forc'd to say in a malignant time, when most men strive to raise themselves a reputation of witt, by Cavill and Dislike.
